ygData.subject: Re: SV: Q: Odd situation...?
ygData.msgSnippet: LOL!  OH!  For a minute there  you had me scared!  I in NO way intended to imply favoritism (though one of my friends claims I was just smiled upon by the
ygData.messageBody:
LOL! OH! For a minute there you had me scared! I in NO way
intended to imply favoritism (though one of my friends claims I was
just "smiled upon by the Gods" and my husband was not <G>). However,
as you mentioned, I wouldn't put it completely past them. I have even
heard rumor (strictly hearsay) that Verant at first had no intention
of having the armor "show" on female characters.... So the guys down
in the design and programming department may have a
few...preferences...they're entertaining. <bg>.

But...Now that you mention it, I may have to create two new
male/female characters with identical stats just to see what
happens... :)

Lliani

On Thu, 4 Nov 1999 18:06:35 -0800, you wrote:

>From: "Steve Graham" <sdgraham@...>
>
>i think the biggest point here is that as far as she can tell, the
>characters are matched except for gender. wouldn't it be one sick joke if
>Verant had been nerfing the genders differently all along so that the female
>is easier to play than her male equivalent? this would definitely
>demonstrate an evil intent by Verant to undermind the family unit and i
>would have to report them to the appropriate conservative left wing
>factions....just kidding.
>
>really wouldn't put it past them though...seriously
